description: If true indicates that the request is asking for the specified action to not occur.

element.comment: The attributes provided with the request qualify what is not to be done. For example, if an effectiveTime is provided, the "do not" request only applies within the specified time. If a performerType is specified then the "do not" request only applies to performers of that type. Qualifiers include: code, subject, occurrence, perormerType and performer.In some cases, the Request.code may pre-coordinate prohibition into the requested action. E.g. "NPO" (nothing by mouth), "DNR" (do not recussitate). If this happens, doNotPerform SHALL NOT be set to true. I.e. The resource shall not have double negation. (E.g. "Do not DNR").
element.definition: If true indicates that the request is asking for the specified action to not occur.
element.isModifierReason: If true this element negates the specified action. For Example, instead of a request for a procedure, it is a request for the procedure to not occur.
element.short: true if request is prohibiting action

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).
